mcmcglm

The mcmcglm package implements the CGGibbs sampler from the article Is Gibbs sampling faster than Hamiltonian Monte Carlo on GLMs?, which has linear run time as a function of number of parameters in a GLM model due to a clever ‚Äúupdate‚Äù of the linear predictor.

The package is implemented in a way that the user can specify any family of the response and any distribution for the prior of the Œ≤\beta parameter, where ùîº[Y|XŒ≤]=g‚àí1(XŒ≤)\mathbb{E}[Y|X\beta]=g^{-1}(X\beta) for a link function gg specified by the family.

Installation

Installation available from GitHub with:

devtools::install_github("mathiaslj/mcmcglm")
